output_list.reason: The mintToken function has an integer overflow that allows the owner to set the balance of an arbitrary user to any value.
The freezeAccount function allows the owner to set the target as an arbitrary user, potentially with no permissions.
The setPrices function is public and allows unauthorized users to set the prices.
The sell function has an integer overflow that allows the owner to retrieve the balance of a user without the original balance.
The buy function has an integer overflow that allows the owner to set the balance of a user to any value.
The setBalance function is public and allows unauthorized users to set the balance of a user.
The freeze function has an argument that allows the owner to freeze the balance of a user without the original balance.
The setOwner function is public and allows unauthorized users to set the owner.
The reverseFreeze function has an argument that allows the owner to reverse the freezing of a user.
The setPermissions function is public and allows unauthorized users to set the permissions of a user.
The owner function has an argument that allows unauthorized users to change the owner.
The reverseOwner function has an argument that allows unauthorized users to reverse the ownership of a user.
